Name: Kohl pot
Description: Small globular, flat-based cosmetic vessel of Egyptian alabaster, with thick rim. Traces survive of the contents, the black lead ore, galena, mined at Gebel Zeit on the Red Sea coast of Egypt facing Sinai. This eyepaint (modern Arabic kohl) was the classic cosmetic for both men and women in dynastic Egypt. The lid was not discovered with the vessel in the tomb where it had been placed, at Abydos.
